body_html:
Hi,

The instrucction per_process_gpu_memory_fraction seems not working on my computer.

I have Quadro K1200, 425/4039 MiB aprox, driver 387.12, cuda 8, cudnn 6, tensorflow 1.4 install from anaconda. python 3.5.2 (64 bits).

my code goes like this:
config = tf.ConfigProto()
config.gpu_options.per_process_gpu_memory_fraction = 0.4
with tf.Graph().as_default():
with tf.Session(config=config) as sess:
...

And I get:

2017-11-04 13:55:44.926218: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:936] failed to allocate 3.94G (4235198464 bytes) from device: CUDA_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY
2017-11-04 13:55:44.933243: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:936] failed to allocate 3.55G (3811678464 bytes) from device: CUDA_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY

how can i check if I am running pywrap_tensorflow.list_devices()?

body:
Hi,

The instrucction per_process_gpu_memory_fraction seems not working on my computer. 

I have Quadro K1200, 425/4039 MiB aprox, driver 387.12, cuda 8, cudnn 6,  tensorflow 1.4 install from anaconda. python 3.5.2 (64 bits).

my code goes like this:
config = tf.ConfigProto()
config.gpu_options.per_process_gpu_memory_fraction = 0.4
with tf.Graph().as_default():
        with tf.Session(config=config) as sess:
            ...


And I get:

2017-11-04 13:55:44.926218: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:936] failed to allocate 3.94G (4235198464 bytes) from device: CUDA_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY
2017-11-04 13:55:44.933243: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:936] failed to allocate 3.55G (3811678464 bytes) from device: CUDA_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY

how can i check if I am running pywrap_tensorflow.list_devices()?
